METS_Profile.title: E-ARK eHealth1 representation METS Profile 1.0 (citsehpj_v1_0)
METS_Profile.abstract: This is the profile for an representation METS following E-ARK eHealth1. Its an extension of the E-ARK SIP profile which in its turn extends the CS IP profile.

resource_model.head: E-ARK eHealth1 REPRESENTATION profile
resource_model.p: This profile together with the E-ARK CITS eHealth1 document describes the root METS document for an IP conforming to the E-ARK CITS eHealth1.

external_schema.name: E-ARK SIP METS Extension
external_schema.context: XML-schema for the attributes added by SIP

note.p: An extension schema with the added attributes for use in this profile.
The schema is used with a namespace prefix of sip.

external_schema.name: E-ARK CSIP METS Extension
external_schema.context: XML-schema for the attributes added by CSIP

note.p: An extension schema with the added attributes for use in this profile.
The schema is identified using the namespace prefix csip.

description_rules.p: The filepath must be decoded consistently throughout all file references within the information package.

description.p: Describes the type of the alternative record ID.
Describes the type of a note for an agent.
Lists the names of specific E-ARK content information type specifications supported or maintained in this METS profile.
Declares the categorical classification of package content.
Describes the uses of the file group `<fileGrp>` that are supported by the profile.
Own names should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

vocabulary.name: Structural map divisions labels in eHealth1
vocabulary.context: Predefined values for different eHealth1 classifications

description.p: Describes the extra terms supported by this profile.
Own names should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.
Describes the status of the descriptive metadata section (dmdSec) which is supported by the profile.
Valid values for the mime types of referenced files.
Describes the type of the structural map `<structMap>` that is supported by the profile.
Own types should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.
Describes the label of the structural map that is supported by the profile.
Own labels should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

description.head: Package Identifier
description.p: The `mets/@OBJID` attribute is mandatory, its value is a string identifier for the METS document.

. For a representation level METS document, this value records the name of the representation (i.e. the name of the top-level representation folder or Patient Medical Record folder which MUST include the primary patient identifier).

description.head: METS Profile
description.p: The value is set to "https://citsehealth1.dilcis.eu/profile/E-ARK-eHealth1-REPRESENTATION.xml".

description.head: Content Category
description.p: The `mets/@TYPE` attribute is set to the value "OTHER".

description.head: Other Content Category
description.p: The `mets/@csip:OTHERTYPE` attribute is set to the value "Patient Medical Records".

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: The `mets/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute is set to the value "citsehpj_v1_0".

description.head: Package header
description.p: The eHealth1 representation METS metsHdr element should comply with metsHdr requirements in the SIP profile.

description.head: Descriptive metadata
description.p: Used to reference Case Patient Clinical Information held in the metadata/descriptive folder of the representation.
There is one dmdSec present for each descriptive metadata file located in the “metadata/descriptive” section of the representation.

description.head: Descriptive metadata identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the descriptive metadata section (`<dmdSec>`) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: Descriptive metadata creation date
description.p: Creation date of the descriptive metadata in this section.

description.head: Status of the descriptive metadata
description.p: Indicates the status of the descriptive metadata using a fixed vocabulary.

description.head: Reference to the document with the descriptive metadata
description.p: There MUST be a reference to the descriptive metadata file located in the folder “metadata/descriptive” of the representation.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: The value for the metadata type is set to "OTHER".

description.head: Type of other metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata used for Patient Clinical Information.
For example the value will be “fhircondition” if the FHIR Condition resource is used.

description.head: Administrative metadata
description.p: The eHealth1 representation METS document amdSec element should comply with amdSec requirements in the CSIP profile.

In eHealth1 it is required that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is general to the package can be held within the root metadata folder and that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is specific to the data held in the representation should be held in the representation metadata folder.

description.head: File section
description.p: The transferred content within the representation is referenced from the file section in different file group elements. Only a single file section (`<fileSec>`) element should be present.
Representation of the Patient Case structural hierarchy is only possible if the file section (`<fileSec>`) is present in the representation.

description.head: Representations (Patient Document) file groups
description.p: The representation (Patient Document) file groups contain the file elements that describe the Patient Documents

The file group (`<fileGrp>`) contains the file elements which describe the Patient Documents. The hierarchical structure of the Patient Medical Records within the CITS eHealth1 requires that digital objects (groups of files that form a single intellectual entity) can be described through the structMap (`<div>`) element.

description.head: Description of the use of the representation (Patient Document) file group
description.p: The value in the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` is the name of the folder structure to the data, e.g "data/Case_ID/Document_ID".

description.head: Reference to Patient Document administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata has been provided at a representation level (i.e. there is rights and/or digital provenance metadata that is specific to the patient data) then this attribute refers to the (`<amdSec>`) of the representation mets.xml by ID.

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: The value of the attribute the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` is set to "citsehpj_v1_0".

description.head: Representation (Patient Document) file group identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the file group used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: File
description.p: The file group (`<fileGrp>`) contains the file elements which describe the digital objects.
Each file element describes one of the Case digital objects

description.head: File reference to the descriptive metadata
description.p: If descriptive metadata has been provided per file, this attribute refers to the file's descriptive metadata by ID.

description.head: Component byte stream
description.p: A file may comprise one or more subsidiary byte streams (e.g. an MPEG4 file might contain separate audio and video streams, each of which is associated with technical metadata).
The repeatable (`<stream>`) element provides a mechanism to record the existence of separate datastreams within a particular file and to associate (`<dmdSec>`) and (`<amdSec>`) with them.

description.head: Component byte stream identifier
description.p: A unique xml:id for this object across the package.

description.head: Component byte stream mimetype
description.p: The IANA mime type for the referenced byte stream.

description.head: Component byte stream original identification
description.p: If an identifier for the byte stream was supplied by the owner, it can be recorded in this attribute.

description.head: Component byte stream reference to administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata has been provided for the byte stream this attribute refers to the streams's administrative metadata by ID.
For the administrativ description of the byte stream the PREMIS standard is recommended.

description.head: Structural description of the representation
description.p: There MUST be one structural map following the requirements in the E-ARK SIP and thus E-ARK CSIP present.

description.head: Structural description of the eHealth1 representation
description.p: Each representation METS file must include ONE structural map (`<structMap>`) element as exactly as described here.
Institutions can add their own additional custom structural maps as separate `<structMap>` sections.

description.head: Type of structural description
description.p: The `mets/structMap/@TYPE` attribute must take the value “PHYSICAL” from the vocabulary.
An additional structural description @TYPE “VIRTUAL” could be added to describe a virtual Case structure that has not been realised in physical folders.

description.head: Name of the structural description
description.p: The `mets/structMap/@LABEL` attribute value is set to “eHealth1” from the vocabulary.

description.head: Structural description identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the structural description (structMap) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: Main structural division
description.p: The structural map comprises a single division.

description.head: Main structural division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Main structural division label
description.p: The representations's top-level structural division `<div>` element's `@LABEL` attribute value must be identical to the representation (Patient Medical Record) identifier, i.e. the same value as the `mets/@OBJID` attribute.

description.head: Metadata division
description.p: The metadata referenced in the administrative and/or descriptive metadata section is described in the structural map with one sub division.

description.head: Metadata division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Metadata division label
description.p: The metadata division `<div>` element's `@LABEL` attribute value must be "Metadata".

description.head: Metadata division administrative metadata referencing
description.p: When there is administrative metadata and the amdSec is present, all administrative metadata MUST be referenced via the administrative sections different identifiers.
All of the `<amdSec>` identifiers are listed in a single `@ADMID` using spaces as delimiters.

description.head: Metadata division descriptive metadata referencing
description.p: When there are descriptive metadata and one or more dmdSec is present, all descriptive metadata MUST be referenced via the descriptive section identifiers.
Every `<dmdSec>` identifier is listed in a single `@DMDID` attribute using spaces as delimiters.

description.head: Documentation division
description.p: The documentation referenced in the file section file groups is described in the structural map with one sub division.

description.head: Documentation division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Documentation division label
description.p: The documentation division `<div>` element in the package uses the value "Documentation" from the vocabulary as the value for the `@LABEL` attribute.

description.head: Documentation file referencing
description.p: All file groups containing documentation described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers. There MUST be one file group reference per `<fptr>` element.

description.head: Documentation file group reference pointer
description.p: A reference, by ID, to the "Documentation" file group.
Related to the requirement which describes the "Documentation" file group in CSIP and the requirement which describes the file group identifier.

description.head: Data division
description.p: Within eHealth1 patient Cases MUST be held within a data folder within a minimum single representation and described in the structural map within a single sub-division. There are no files contained within the data division.

description.head: Data division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Data division label
description.p: The package's data division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "DATA", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Patient Case division
description.p: Each Patient Case contains Documents that are related in some way (e.g. chronologically and/or share a particular set of diagnoses and/or treatments).
A Patient Case is a folder located in the ”Data” folder within the representation and may contain any number of Sub-cases and Documents.
Every representation must contain at least one Patient Case. A Case is represented within a second level sub-division.

description.head: Patient case division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Patient case division label
description.p: The package's patient case division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "CASE", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Patient Document division
description.p: Each Patient Case MAY contain individual Data Files that are related logically and together form Documents (e.g. a book, video, image and annotation, document and audio notes).

description.head: Patient Document division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Patient Document division label
description.p: The package's Patient Documentation division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "DOCUMENT", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Data File division
description.p: Data Files are components that contain data and have associated MIME file types.
A Data File can be a single bit stream or can encapsulate bit streams and attributes according to a standard such as a DICOM or MP4.

description.head: Data File division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Data File division label
description.p: The package's patient case/documentation/data file division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "DATAFILE", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Data File division file group reference
description.p: All file groups containing content described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers. One file group reference per fptr-element.

description.head: Data File division file group reference ID
description.p: The pointer to the identifier for the file group containing the data files.

description.head: Patient Sub-case division
description.p: Each Patient Sub-case contains Documents that are related in some way (e.g. chronologically and/or share a particular set of diagnoses and/or treatments).
A Patient Sub-case is a folder located in a Case folder within the representation and must contain at least one Document.

description.head: Patient Sub-case division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Patient Sub-case division label
description.p: The package's patient sub-case division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "SUBCASE", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Patient Document division
description.p: Each Patient sub-case can contain individual Data Files that are related logically and together form Documents (e.g. a book, video, image and annotation, document and audio notes).

description.head: Patient Document division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Patient Documentat division label
description.p: The package's patient sub-case/documentation division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "DOCUMENT", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Data file division
description.p: Data Files are components that contain data and have associated MIME file types.
A Data File can be a single bit stream or can encapsulate bit streams and attributes according to a standard such as a DICOM or MP4.

description.head: Data file division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Data file division label
description.p: The package's sub-case/documentation/data file division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "DATAFILE", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Data File division file group reference
description.p: The pointer to the identifier for the file group containing the data files.

description.head: Data File division file group reference ID
description.p: The pointer to the identifier for the file group containing the data files.

description.head: structLink
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the structural links is found in the METS Primer

description.head: behaviorSec
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the behavior section is found in the METS Primer
Requirements not stated in CITS eHealth1
Requirements not stated in CITS eHealth1
Requirements not stated in CITS eHealth1

METS example of representation METS dmdSec:s with reference to HL7 FHIR Patient Clinical Information is used
METS representation example for eHealth1 with file information together with the info from CS IP.
METS representation example for eHealth1 with file information and streams together with the info from CS IP.
METS example of the eHealth1 mandatory structural map present in the representation METS for eHealth1 with Case Structure

mets:div.LABEL: Metadata
mets:div.ADMID: appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-1 appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-2 appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-3 appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-4 appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-5 appdx1.digiprov-premis-file-6
